title: Teddy Bear Fence destroyed
text:
It was plush carnage along the Copper Coast Highway today as vandals destroyed hundreds of teddy bears displayed along a fence line.

The distinctive teddy bear fence was established two years ago by radio identity Andrew “Cosi” Costello and grew to include around 2000 soft toys.

The fence line became an improvised landmark for the region but came under fire when safety concerns arose about drivers slowing down to look at the plush toys.

media_camera The Teddy Bear Fence on the Copper Coast Highway, South Australia. Picture: Seth Mundy

Cosi took to social media to post a video of the destruction that show teddy bears scattered along the fence line.

He also vented his frustration at the vandals and said he was seeking legal advice.

“We have been in the process of trying to relocate the Teddy Bear fence on Yorke Peninsula,” he said.

“It’s not an easy task but we are getting it sorted. In fact I’ve got a meeting about it tomorrow.

“For safety they reduced the speed limit around the fence and this made a lot of people furious. But it was only ever going to be temporary.

“Some were not patient enough and hated the teddy bears so much they decided to cut them down and toss them over the fence.”

media_camera The toys scattered over the fence after its destruction. Picture: South Aussie with Cosi

However, Cosi said he saw the vandalism coming and set up infra-red cameras on the surrounding gumtrees which monitored the fence.

Camouflaged among the leaves he said the cameras took “crystal clear shots of faces of people cutting the bears off” as well as their licence plate numbers.

“There’s a lot of bad evil stuff happening in the world,” Cosi said

“If a Teddy Bear Fence annoys you so much you need to destroy it you really need to have a good hard look at yourself …

“To the people that destroyed the fence: we did a Facebook poll on the fence and 91 per cent of people loved it and wanted it saved.

“You were in the 9 per cent of fence haters.

“You don’t have the right to ruin it for the majority of South Aussies who love it.”
description: A distinctive stretch of fence adorned with teddy bears and plush toys has been targeted by a callous attack. But the vandals were being filmed the whole time.
